text: Cosmioconcha rikae is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Columbellidae, the dove snails. ==Description== The length of the shell attains 7.9 mm. ==Distribution== This species occurs in the Caribbean Sea off Panama. ==References== * Monsecour, K. & Monsecour, D., 2006. Two new Cosmioconcha (Gastropoda: Neogastropoda: Columbellidae) from the Caribbean. Gloria Maris 45(1-2): 7-13 ==External links== * Rosenberg, G.; Moretzsohn, F.; García, E. F. (2009). Gastropoda (Mollusca) of the Gulf of Mexico, Pp. 579–699 in: Felder, D.L. and D.K. Camp (eds.), Gulf of Mexico–Origins, Waters, and Biota. Texas A&M; Press, College Station, Texas Category:Columbellidae Category:Gastropods described in 2006
title: Cosmioconcha rikae
